decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game while dealing damage to the opponent with Vial Smasher the Fierce. The deck includes a variety of spells to control the board, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and protect your own creatures. It also has a selection of powerful creatures and a few disruptive elements like True-Name Nemesis and Venser, Shaper Savant. The mana base is designed to support these strategies with a mix of dual lands and fetchlands. Overall, the deck is built to maintain a balance between aggression and control, using Vial Smasher's ability to deal damage as a consistent threat while controlling the game with spells and creatures.

The main goal of this deck is to control and disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Notion Thief and True-Name Nemesis. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage engines like Dark Confidant, Baleful Strix, and Ancestral Vision while also presenting a clock with evasive creatures like Vendilion Clique and Wydwen, the Biting Gale. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and includes utility lands like Wasteland and Mishra's Factory. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil provides additional card advantage and control elements to maintain dominance in the game.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures in combination with efficient removal spells and disruption to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly. Saskia the Unyielding serves as the commander, providing additional damage and spreading it across multiple opponents. The deck includes a wide range of powerful creatures such as Tarmogoyf, Knight of the Reliquary, and Siege Rhino, supported by cards like Lightning Bolt, Path to Exile, and Thoughtseize to deal with threats and control the board. Additionally, the deck includes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Rancor to enhance the creatures' offensive capabilities. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and take advantage of the aggressive nature of the commander to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Selvala, Heart of the Wilds' ability to generate massive amounts of mana by playing creatures with high power that can untap Selvala, such as Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger. This mana is then used to cast powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger early in the game to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes various combo pieces such as Umbral Mantle and Staff of Domination to generate infinite mana loops and win the game in one explosive turn. The goal is to ramp up quickly, draw cards efficiently, and assemble the combos needed to overpower the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, card advantage, and manipulating time to outmaneuver opponents. It utilizes Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander to provide card advantage and recursion. The deck includes various counterspells like Counterspell, Mana Leak, and Force of Will, along with card draw spells like Brainstorm and Serum Visions. It also includes extra turn spells like Time Warp and Temporal Mastery to gain tempo and stay ahead. The deck aims to protect its powerful spells and win conditions, such as Aetherflux Reservoir or Teferi, Temporal Archmage, while disrupting opponents' strategies with bounce spells and control elements.

This deck focuses on efficiently controlling the opponent's actions through countering spells, bouncing threats, and disrupting their mana base. By using card draw spells like Ponder, Preordain, and Ancestral Vision, the deck aims to maintain card advantage while deploying threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and True-Name Nemesis. With a suite of powerful counterspells like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Cryptic Command, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Skred, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own win conditions. Additionally, the deck utilizes disruptive creatures like Glen Elendra Archmage and Sower of Temptation to control the board and protect its own threats.

The deck revolves around controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy while draining their life total with Kambal, Consul of Allocation's ability. It combines removal spells like To the Slaughter, Tragic Slip, and Wrath of God with disruptive cards like Nevermore and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana Vess and Sorin, Grim Nemesis for card advantage and additional threats. It has a mix of efficient creatures like Vampire Nighthawk and Mirran Crusader to pressure the opponent while gaining life. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with its versatile removal suite and resilient threats, ultimately grinding out a victory through attrition.

This deck revolves around quickly ramping up mana with various land tutors and mana dorks to bring out powerful threats like Avenger of Zendikar and Craterhoof Behemoth. The commander, Titania, Protector of Argoth, synergizes with sacrificing lands to generate value and create an aggressive aggro strategy. Additionally, the deck includes a range of removal options and card draw spells to maintain tempo and control the board. By efficiently mana ramping and utilizing the commander's abilities, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a wide board presence and finish them off with massive trampling creatures or direct damage from cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Garruk Wildspeaker.
